intro: Taraxacum angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and a hollow, hairy stem that rises to bear a single, yellow flower head. The plant produces a distinctive seed dispersal mechanism known as a pappus, which consists of fine, feathery bristles that aid in wind pollination. It thrives in temperate regions and is often found in disturbed soils, lawns, and open fields. Taraxacum angustifolium is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
